item.title: Rino add a quote by Paul Halmos
item.description: "When a student comes and asks, "Should I become a mathematician?" the answer should be no. If you have to ask, you shouldn't even ask." -- Paul Halmos

item.title: Rino add a quote by Paul Erdos
item.description:
"[<i>When asked why are numbers beautiful</i>?]
It’s like asking why is [author:Ludwig van Beethoven|40589]’s Ninth Symphony beautiful. If you don't see why, someone can't tell you. I know numbers are beautiful. If they aren't beautiful, nothing is." -- Paul Erdos

item.title: Rino add a quote by Sophia Kovalevskaya
item.description: "It is impossible to be a mathematician without being a poet in soul." -- Sophia Kovalevskaya

item.title: Rino add a quote by Sapardi Djoko Damono (Mengalirlah, Sungai)
item.description: "hanyutkan, sungai, beribu kata, lagu, dan tanda mata yang tak sempat dialamatkan kepada Dunia" -- Sapardi Djoko Damono (Mengalirlah, Sungai)

item.title: Rino add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "Prime numbers are what is left when you have taken all the patterns away. I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them." -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Rino add a quote by Paul Erdos
item.description: "A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems" -- Paul Erdos
